Author: Audo#5667
Content:
Indeed, in my humble opinion we need at least three things which should be kept separate

 1) the open source project (as it is)
 2) an entity or entities driving business adoption (blockchain as a service)
 3) startup incubator / accelelator

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: The development of Komodo is already decentralized and open source, should remain as such, a business entity would simply be the experts that know how to leverage the Komodo open source platform for business purposes and have a close relationship with the developing team. They use that knowledge and development relationship to create products, services, for businesses that drive revenue using the Komodo platform, which is shared in the form of R&D (paying Komodo developers for continued work as "contractors" or outside sources, paying for other types of additional costs, salaries, expansions, marketing, client acquisition etc).

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: That's my belief on this.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: That way we have a business entity that is working to leverage the Komodo team/platform by offering its products and services to other business entities (on behalf of Komodo)

Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
The difference is many of these entities that will be providing BaaS to businesses can use any platform including Komodo. There are businesses out there that want to use Komodo but are hesitant to work with a decentralized group of anonymous developers. They could use a 3rd party but we would be leaving a huge hole in the market of established businesses looking to partner with a coin team. A separate but official entity provides us some means of outreach to businesses that shows we are a legitimate project and with close ties with the developing team. 

This isn't saying all businesses are going to go through this official team and not a 3rd party, but right now Komodo is in a spot where they have no way of reaching out in any official capacity. I think having an official entity will help us bridge that gap.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: having the entity technically separate prevents any legal recourse from happening to the entity from Komodo actions or refusal of KYC, and any recourse happening to the business from shutting down the Komodo project. The "official" capacity should be in the closeness of the relationship, and the use of the entities revenues to hire/pay Komodo devs for their work and redistribute the remaining in a way that helps grow the ecosystem.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: @Acura the idea isn't to close telegram, but to instead funnel that community into one primary location.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: Previously it made sense to have both telegram and slack as they served different audiences and purposes.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: The issue with our slack was the barrier to access. You had to join a wait list, wait until you get on. Then there were tons of channels and it was intimidating for a new user.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: Telegram was easy to join, and had just one room to worry about. Considering Discord is also easy to join, and is being more widely adopted in this industry, we thought it made sense to consolidate.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: we definitely wanted to first consult both yourself and @yorklab  as you guys are active in that community.

Author: yorklab#7270
Content: I understand Acura's concerns, there are certain aspects of Telegram that work well and it is much easier to monitor just one single Channel. But I do think it's a good idea to start funneling the crowd over to Discord. If eventually nobody posts on telegram you can always shut it down at that point.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Been thinking of an addition to HyperDEX. I posted it in their channel to see if it would be a good fit. I'll post it here too.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: It's a way I've been thinking about how to resolve some liquidity problems we have with our DEX

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I can't post pictures in here though

Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
I was thinking a chat could provide some type of positive benefit especially for atomic swap powered exchanges. I'm thinking that if you were to open HyperDEX to make a trade and see little volume you might just leave. Trades can happen any time but only when someone is on and leaves the DEX is open. So a chat box might give people a reason to stay on and chat, find traders, or do something while they wait for confirmations. 

Obviously this could be done in here or telegram or something (BlackJoker mentioned Matrix servers for chat which would be really cool, I'm still reading up on how they work exactly) but to be able to access it from the DEX would be cool. A chat might be a way for people to set up direct trades also, just come for "the hanging out" and end up finding someone wanting to trade or someone telling you about a coin you didn't know of.

I think for true DEXs, liquidity will always be a problem. CEX can only have a small sample size of the population worth in volume, amounting to no more than the total people on their exchange and coins in their wallets, but CEX are very active because the people there, are there to trade. 

Because a DEX can trade from the same wallets we safely store coins in, we can have true population sized volume (every coin in every wallet), but only if people are on at the right times to find each other (makes it tougher on other sides of the globe) and actively trading. so it would only make sense to give them more reason to be active on the DEX than simply to trade and close the DEX (takes their potential volume with them)

Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
So this might build a lot more users who are on it for trading and chat (about trading or w.e.) which can add more liquidity. Just thinking about the times a few years ago sitting in Poloniex Trollbox talking with people and then buying some pump, or learning about different projects (actually its how I learned about Komodo, someone mentioned that we should be pushing polo to add KMD) 

we'll see if it's something HyperDEX or BarterDEX likes? But seeing as this is the marketing channel, what are our thoughts on this as a marketing opportunity or way to increase liquidity??
